author: potuz
content: I'm looking at the doc with the proposed specification for withdrawals. What are the risks of not having the withdrawal list in the beacon state? We already hold a list of validators and they themselves hold their withdrawn epoch. So for proof of processed withdrawal that should suffice as there can be only one per pubkey.

author: potuz
content: I worry that with validator rotation both lists of validator and withdrawal will grow quite fast

author: jgm
content: If only there were some way to withdraw the excess balance without needing to exit and resubmit the validator, that would help right? ðŸ˜†

author: potuz
content: Hehe don't pick another fight with me, I'm all for it as long as it's implemented at the same time of withdrawals. Although from reading that document it looks that the partial withdrawals that fit there won't really alleviate this but actually make it worse

author: jgm
content: Yeah the model I proposed stay entirely on the beacon chain.  And yeah reality at the moment is that we're most likely to see a "withdrawal and associated tidy-ups" patch that comes in after consensus upgrade.

author: potuz
content: Yeah I did like your proposal. It's sort of not very helpful to single validators since they're expecting to propose a block seldomly after the merge. I had proposed to simply send all rewards to another address and it's very simple to implement, but admittedly I don't know of the risks of immediate validator transfers

author: potuz
content: But my question above remains I'd like to know the risks in not keeping the list of withdrawals

author: jgm
content: It could be possible to remove the validator info (leaving a stub)  once you go past the weak subjectivity period (I think), but I suspect that we're going to end up with some way to change ownership of validators and see that being used more far more often than actually exiting (as that comes with a cost of Ether not obtained from validating whilst the validator waits for the withdrawal period to clear) so it may not end up being a concern.

author: potuz
content: Oh but I understand a need to keep the list of validators in the state, those already hold a withdrawn flag, I don't understand why the need of keeping an extra list with the withdrawal and the epoch, presumably one can add the epoch to the validator itself instead of a flag and then just keep the list of validators
